awardEventDetails.title: 2020 Winner AFI Award
awardEventDetails.for: TV Program of the Year
awardEventDetails.description: (WHEN THEY SEE US brings modern history to light - and demands it not repeat itself. Ava DuVernay's epic chronicle of injustice digs deep beneath the headlines to illuminate the singularly human stories of the Central Park Five. In the eyes of this amazing acting ensemble, reflections of hope are lost in despair until exoneration years later. This is compelling, powerful storytelling that appeals to an American ideal of freedom for all.)

awardsHtml:
30 wins & 78 nominations

Primetime Emmy Awards

2019 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Limited Series
Ava DuVernay - Jeff Skoll - Jonathan King - Jane Rosenthal - Robert De Niro - Berry Welsh - Oprah Winfrey
2019 Winner Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Lead Actor in a Limited Series or Movie
Jharrel Jerome (For playing: "Korey Wise".)
2019 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Limited Series or Movie
Vera Farmiga (For playing: "Elizabeth Lederer".)
2019 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Limited Series or Movie
Michael Kenneth Williams (For playing: "Bobby McCray".)
2019 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Limited Series or Movie
John Leguizamo (For playing: "Raymond Santana, Sr.".)

TV Program of the Year
(WHEN THEY SEE US brings modern history to light - and demands it not repeat itself. Ava DuVernay's epic chronicle of injustice digs deep beneath the headlines to illuminate the singularly human stories of the Central Park Five. In the eyes of this amazing acting ensemble, reflections of hope are lost in despair until exoneration years later. This is compelling, powerful storytelling that appeals to an American ideal of freedom for all.)
